title.narrative: WASH OP 2 CLIMATE CHANGE AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE

description.narrative: By 2023 the Government and its partners have capacity to implement risk-Informed approaches that strengthen resilience to climate change and lead Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) preparedness and response to humanitarian crisis, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, Government has the capacity at national and decentralized level to improve policy, planning, monitoring, coordination and resource leveraging of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programme for equitable and sustainable access to climate resilient Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services at scale

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023 the Government and its partners have capacity to implement risk-Informed approaches that strengthen resilience to climatechange and lead WASH preparedness and response to humanitarian crisis

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF finalised the Global Environment Facility (GEF) project, which aims to improve communities&39; adaptation capacities and resilience to climate change. UNICEF installed Groundwater Early Warning Systems to monitor drought and groundwater reserves and generates a monthly bulletin that is shared with all partners. Furthermore, for UNCTAD15, UNICEF supported the Ministry of Water to organise a conference on “accelerating sustainable solutions for better access to water in the context of climate change”.Emergency response was key in 2021, during which UNICEF provided effective WASH responses to more than 1,700,000 people affected by drought and the COVID-19 pandemic | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
